Dispute_Type: Refugee protection claim based on persecution due to corruption allegations
Legal_Issue: Whether the tribunal erred in law by failing to provide adequate reasons for finding the applicant did not take reasonable steps to seek state protection
Governing_Law: Canadian refugee law, presumption of state protection
Procedural_Stage: Judicial review of Refugee Protection Division decision
Evidence_Assessment: Tribunal failed to analyze key evidence such as police demanding bribes and threats from alleged persecutors
Decision_Outcome: Original decision denying protection was quashed
Burden_of_Proof: Claimant must show they took reasonable steps to seek state protection unless objectively unreasonable
Legal_Rule: A claimant must demonstrate reasonable steps to seek state protection unless it is objectively unreasonable to do so
Procedural_Issue: Inadequate reasons provided by the tribunal
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution in Mexico related to corruption allegations
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Tribunal failed to conduct proper analysis, resulting in procedurally unfair outcome
Key_Evidence_Considered: Complaints filed with authorities, relocation after complaints, demands for bribes by police, ongoing threats from alleged persecutors
Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Canadian refugee determination process
Applicant_Challenge: Tribunal did not adequately assess availability of state protection in Mexico
Court_Result: Judicial review allowed, decision quashed, case remitted for re-hearing
Legal_Rule_Source: Canadian jurisprudence on refugee claims and state protection
Standard_of_Proof: Clear and convincing evidence to rebut presumption of state protection
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence, documentary evidence of complaints, credibility indicators
Outcome: Remanded for new hearing before a different tribunal
Legal_Provision: Section 96 of IRPA (jurisdiction of Federal Court), Section 101(1)(a) regarding refugee protection
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections related to refugee protection and state protection obligations
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Persecution based on corruption allegations in Mexico
Governing_Rule: Presumption of state protection unless rebutted with clear and convincing evidence
